entry.title: Re: How to do bulk upload for OData v4 service in 1 Batch...
entry.content:
@vishalsharma_19 is almost right, you just need to use $$updateGroupId:

const groupId = "bulkUpload";
var oOperation = oModel.bindList("/WarehouseData", null, null, null, {
      $$updateGroupId: groupId,
});
excelSheetsData.map(async (value) => {
       var payload = {
           IsActiveEntity: true,
           plant : value.plant,
           warehouse : value.warehouse,
           quantity : value.quantity
       };
       oOperation.create(payload);
       oModel.submitBatch(groupId)
});

 This way, each call to ODataListBinding#create is putting a POST into the group called "bulkUpload" and then the call to ODataModel#submitBatch is closing the current change set and opening a new one 🙂 If you do not specify $$updateGroupId, ODataListBinding#create defaults to the model's update group ID, which defaults to its group ID, which defaults to "$auto" - but then ODataModel#submitBatch is using the wrong group ID and cannot make a difference.

nope , Save your complex ABAP queries as CDS and write selects to CDS . This will be way ahead :).

entry.title: Re: SAP ASE DBACOCKPIT: No recent DB Backups displayed (DB/Transaction Dumps)
entry.content: @tilman_model-bosch: Thank you, that's done the trick. In line with the note I have checked the content (Dump history) of proxy table 'saptools..historyDumps'. Here I could see that the entries up to May 2025 , later entries were missing. Hence, I have dropped the proxy table (drop table historyDumps) and recreate the table with all current dumps by running 'sp_dump_history @operation='create_table', @NAME='saptools.dbo.historyDumps'. This fixed the issue. Current Database/Transaction dumps are now visible in the DBACockpit (Database SID --> Backups and Revovery --> Database Overview/History). So thanks a lot for help & tip, and all the best

entry.title: Customer & Partner Roundtable for SAP BTP ABAP Environment #28
entry.content:
👉 The call for contributions for one of the upcoming roundtables is open! 

 

If you want to show a demo or share a use case scenario for SAP BTP ABAP Environment, send us an email and we will get back to you.
 

Introduction

As SAP BTP ABAP environment (aka Steampunk) and ABAP Cloud became more popular inside and outside of SAP, there is a high demand for rolling out the latest product news and updates, asking questions, and showing demos. 

💡 You can find the slides presented, recordings, and further references from the previous roundtables in this GitHub repository.

Meeting Information

When:                                                                      
  • October 30, 2:00 - 3:00 PM CEST  – Zoom Meeting (please register in advance) 
 
Who:
  • All interested customers, partners, and stakeholders are invited to join this roundtable
  • BTP ABAP team:
    • Frank Jentsch (Product Lead for SAP BTP ABAP Environment)
    • Iwona Hahn (Product Management)
    • Jan Ole Skirke (Development Expert)
Preliminary Agenda:
  • Product update for SAP BTP ABAP Environment
  • Downtime-optimized hotfix collection updates for SAP BTP ABAP Environment including demo
  • Q&A 
Looking forward to meeting you!
 

 



Check out our SAP Business Technology ABAP Environment page in SAP Community for product updates and upcoming events.

entry.title: Re: How to identify in debugging that document posted is...
entry.content:
Look at INV_TRAN (values of domain MRM_VORGANG)

  • 1 Invoice
  • 2 Credit Memo
  • 3 Subsequent Debit
  • 4 Subsequent Credit

This field

  • Can be found in FM MRM_INVOICE_POST, parameter I_RBKPV
  • Look also at 1156325 - BAdIs in the Logistics Invoice Verification environment

entry.title: Artificial Intelligence and SAP Master Data Governance
entry.content:
It is a no brainer that high-speed availability of elevated quality data is crucial in state-of-the-art master data processing. Therefore, SAP Master Data Governance addresses this topic for quite a while with features like: 

  • ML-based rule mining  
  • derivation of field values  
  • data provider integration for the automated take-over of proven reference data from 3rd party data providers and 
  • most recently with the integration of generative AI 

AI is a game changer in many fields, and therefore I’d like to shed light on its ever increasing impact on master data processing.

The Impact of AI on Master Data Governance: A New Era of Intelligent Data Management

In today’s digital economy, data is more than just an asset - it’s the foundation of business intelligence, compliance, and operational success. Among the many types of enterprise data, master data - including customer, vendor, and product data - plays a central role in ensuring consistency and accuracy across systems. However, managing and governing this data has traditionally been a complex, manual, and error-prone process.

With the rise of Artificial Intelligence (AI), master data governance is undergoing an additional transformation. AI brings speed, intelligence, and automation to data governance processes, enabling organizations to maintain high data quality standards while significantly reducing manual effort and cost. AI benefits are in the hands of Master Data Management business users as they will be empowered using functions in SAP Master Data Governance, without additional tools and training and with increased flexibility and ease governing business partner data in future.

Challenges of Ungoverned Master Data

Organizations that rely on ungoverned master data practices face numerous challenges:

  • Manual data entry is prone to human error and inconsistencies across departments and systems.
  • Duplicate or outdated records compromise decision-making and customer experience.
  • Global data compliance requirements make it harder to enforce consistent rules and formats.

These challenges can lead to poor data quality, inefficiencies, and even financial and reputational risks.

AI’s Transformational Role in Master Data Management

AI has the potential to enhance every aspect of master data governance. From automating routine tasks to predicting and preventing errors, AI can enable organizations to transition from reactive data management to proactive data stewardship. This includes the following aspects:

Data Quality and Cleansing

AI algorithms could automatically identify missing, incomplete, or inconsistent data. For example, if a product entry lacks a critical attribute, AI can detect the issue and either correct it or flag it for review. Natural Language Processing (NLP) helps interpret unstructured data, enabling organizations to extract and standardize information from disparate sources.

Intelligent Matching and Deduplication

AI excels at fuzzy matching, which is critical for identifying duplicate records that may not be exact matches. Whether it's variations in customer names, addresses, or product codes, AI learns from historical corrections to improve deduplication over time, even across different languages or local conventions.

Predictive Data Governance

AI could proactively monitor data entry patterns and detect anomalies before they create downstream problems. For instance, if a vendor record deviates from standard formats or contains unusual combinations of data, AI can suggest corrections or flag it for review.

Workflow Automation and Smart Approvals

AI could optimize approval workflows by learning from past decisions and routing requests to the right people automatically. This reduces the cycle time for master data changes and ensures compliance with governance policies without unnecessary delays.

Data Steward Assistance

Data stewards benefit from AI acting as a co-pilot - suggesting actions, prioritizing issues, and providing insights. AI-powered chatbots or virtual assistants can help them query records, update data, or perform validations faster and more accurately.

Current scope and trends in SAP Master Data Governance

 SAP MDG has started embedding AI and machine learning into its framework to enhance data quality and governance automation. Please read following recent articles for a clearer picture: 

  • Inclusion of Generative AI in MDG (as of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition Feature Pack Stack 02) 
    used for summary of changes and assisted changes in central governance (classic mode), and for optional business partner processing (in cloud-ready mode) initiated by a Joule dialog. 
  • Gen AI-based assisted change for custom objects and summary of mass changes (as of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition Feature Pack Stack 03) 
    AI-assisted changes in central governance for reuse entities in custom objects and AI-based summary of change requests with multiple objects (mass changes). 
  • Master Data Governance Facilitating Generative AI 
    Blog post on how generative AI impacts master data management and vice versa. 

The AI-enabled SAP Joule assistant utilizes natural language processing to allow employees to execute professional Master Data Governance tasks, such as updating business partner information and checking governance workflows, without needing deep MDG expertise. To get the full picture of planned AI innovations in SAP Master Data Governance across the entire MDG solution portfolio, see the SAP Roadmap Explorer.

And finally, I would also like to refer to the following planned AI Webinar: Upcoming MDM Webinar (October 15th) with the Hackett Group

This webinar is with The Hackett Group and focused on the recent Hackett Group World Class Matrix for MDM Software, in which SAP participated. It is a live, interactive webinar, that will journey through the evolution of Master Data Management (MDM) – from its foundational role in process improvement to its impact on analytical and AI outcomes. We will wrap up with a summary of the capabilities of SAP Master Data Governance for operational excellence and accurate analytics and AI as well as discuss how AI within MDM is driving new value.

The registration page is available here: https://event.on24.com/wcc/r/5071369/89EF715DACF727EA399DE330113B0340. 

The impact is measurable: reduced manual effort, fewer data errors, and improved compliance.

Additional Considerations going forward

AI holds great promise for the future, following considerations shall always be kept in mind:

  • Data bias: AI models will have to be trained on diverse and accurate datasets to avoid reinforcing existing biases. MDG can provide proper basis for this.
  • Data privacy: Organizations must ensure that AI respects privacy laws like GDPR and CCPA when processing sensitive master data.
  • Model transparency: AI decisions, such as why a record was flagged or approved, must be explainable and auditable.
  • Human oversight: AI should augment - not replace - human governance. Final decisions should remain with accountable physical persons.

The benefit lies in the strong hand in hand co-work of proven master data governance augmented by AI innovation aspects.

Conclusion

AI has the potential to revolutionize master data governance by making it smarter, faster, and more proactive. By automating manual processes, improving data quality, and enhancing governance workflows. AI empowers organizations to manage their most critical data assets with greater agility and confidence with one stop-shop - Joule.

As businesses strive for digital transformation, adopting AI in MDG is not just a technological upgrade - it’s a strategic imperative. The organizations that embrace this shift now will be the ones that lead in data-driven innovation tomorrow.

As AI technologies mature, organizations will move from data maintenance to intelligent data orchestration - turning governance into a strategic advantage.

I hope this information sharing about Joule insights within MDG is interesting for you to read. If you enjoyed this article, be sure to subscribe and leave us a review. Until next time, keep innovating and stay curious! 

To stay on track, simply follow the SAP Community Topic Page for SAP Master Data Governance, read the MDG-related blogs, and join the  Q&A forum. 

Best, 
Ria

entry.title: Re: How to create/export a CSV file from Datasphere?
entry.content:
Datasphere does not have a process to generate and serve files.

You should use a sencodary system to archive this:

  • Share Table to Open SQL Schema, to allow access from an external system via SQL interface. From there you can read and export to CSV using any programming language like Python, js, etc or SQL clients like DBeaver, etc  
  • Create an analytical model on top of the table and pusblish odata service to access with this protocol. Use the odata to access data and generate the CSV with it. It's easy with Python and Pandas, powershell, or Excel.
  • Integrate an object storage system with a connection in DSP, like AWS S3, and use Replication Flow to export the content of the table to the S3. You can get from there the file.

Regards,

entry.title: Re: SAP ASE DBACOCKPIT: No recent DB Backups displayed (DB/Transaction Dumps)
entry.content: @tilman_model-bosch: thanks a lot Thats done the trick. In line with the SAP Note I hhave checked the contents (database dumps) of proxy table 'saptools..historyDumps'. Dumps were listed until the end of May2025, all other current dumps missing.So I drpped the the table (drop table historyDumps) and recreate table with content by running 'sp_dump_history @operation='create_table', @NAME='saptools.dbo.historyDumps'. This fixed the issue. All database/transction dumps are now visible in the DBACockpit (Database SID --> Backups and Revovery --> Database Overview/History). So thansk a lot for help and all the best Thorsten

entry.title: What's New in SAP Asset Performance Management 2509
entry.content:
Keeping assets performing optimally requires structure, flexibility, and reliable data. This release introduces the Manage Reliability Cases app to centralize investigations, giving teams a clear view of alerts, operating conditions, and assigned actions in one place. The CAP-based recommendation apps are enabled with extensibility, allowing users to enhance the standard application with custom fields. You can now also assign multiple task lists as well as create standalone recommendations directly for industrial system elements. In asset health monitoring, we have introduced variant management to the Monitor Alerts app, and enabled curated visual inspection results to enhance condition-based monitoring by providing cleaner data for smarter, more accurate AI models.

Let's dive in to the highlights of SAP Asset Performance Management 2509!

Manage Reliability Cases - New Application Available!

Repeated equipment issues, such as high-temperature alerts on critical pumps, often require time-consuming investigations. Without a structured process, root causes may remain unclear, preventive actions may be missed, and reliability engineers spend valuable time chasing fragmented information.

Solution

The new Manage Reliability Cases application brings structure and visibility into the process. It centralizes investigations by linking alert analysis, operating condition reviews, and documentation of findings in one place. Reliability engineers can assign responsibilities, track actions, and ensure that recommendations are integrated with ongoing maintenance and risk management activities.

This provides the following benefits:

  • Faster root-cause identification and more effective preventive measures
  • Reduced unplanned downtime and improved equipment reliability
  • Better collaboration across engineering and maintenance teams
  • Clear documentation that supports compliance and continuous improvement

For more information, see the SAP Help Portal Manage Reliability Cases.

 

New CAP Applications for Recommendations

SAP Asset Performance Management (APM) is undergoing a significant transition to the SAP Cloud Application Programming (CAP) model. This transition aims to enhance the functionality, scalability, and maintainability of the APM applications. With release 2509, the Manage Recommendations and Implement Recommendations  apps have transitioned.

To use these applications, you must have the role Recommendation_CAP assigned to your user. For more information on release timelines, support, and known limitations, refer to SAP Note 3603407.

 

Field Extensibility for Recommendations

The original recommendations apps have limited flexibility for custom or industry-specific data.  The new CAP-based recommendations apps allow field extensibility to add custom fields.

For example (see screenshot above):

  • Added a "Version Number" and "Is Latest Version" custom field. These fields are also available as filters and columns on the application list page.
  • Added a new "Attachments" tab.
  • Support for additional types of Proactive Recommendations.
  • The extended fields also available in the applications list page as filters and columns.

With CAP-based recommendations, organizations can unlock entirely new possibilities for proactive maintenance. Instead of being limited to static instructions, recommendations can now incorporate flexible conditions, tailored actions, and structured plans that evolve with operational needs.

 

Assign Multiple Task Lists to Recommendations

Maintenance recommendations were previously limited to a single task list, making it hard to coordinate preventive and corrective actions and forcing teams to work around system constraints.

Now, multiple general maintenance task lists can be linked to any reactive or proactive recommendation. This allows teams to plan and coordinate complex maintenance activities directly in the system, reflecting real-world operational needs.

This brings the following benefits:

  • Seamless integration of preventive and reactive actions
  • Flexible planning across multiple task lists
  • More efficient execution of maintenance activities
  • Improved asset performance and operational reliability

For more information, see the SAP Help Portal Creating a Task List for Recommendation.

 

Assign industrial system elements to standalone recommendations 

Recommendations were previously limited to technical objects, making it difficult and inefficient to address systemic issues that affect multiple assets, entire processes, or plant-wide safety measures.

You can now create standalone recommendations directly for industrial system elements—just as for technical objects—without requiring an assessment. This enables a single, actionable recommendation to cover broader contexts, such as an entire production line or general operational best practice.

This enables the following:

  • Faster creation and management of recommendations
  • Flexibility to work without mandatory assessment linkage
  • More efficient mitigation of potential system failures across functional asset structures

For more information, see the SAP Help Portal Assigning an Industrial System Element to a Recommendation 

Enhanced OData API for Standalone Recommendations

To enable the enhancements to the recommendations mentioned above the OData API for Recommendation has been enhanced to:

  • Include task list selection for maintenance plan assignment or creation
  • Get or assign industrial system elements
  • Remove industrial system elements
  • Get assigned industrial systems
  • Get or assign multiple task lists

For more information, refer to API for Recommendation.

 

API Updates for Risk and Criticality Assessments & Risk and Criticality Assessment Templates

As preparation for the transition to the Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP), the Risk and Criticality Assessment and Template GraphQL APIs have been deprecated. We recommend migrating to the Risk and Criticality Assessment OData V4 APIs, which align with CAP and deliver enhanced efficiency and capabilities. For further details, see SAP Note 3603407 and the official documentation Risk and Criticality Assessment ODATA V4 API and Risk and Criticality Assessment Template ODATA V4 API.

 

Variant Management for Alerts

We’re excited to announce a major UI improvement in the Monitor Alerts app - Variant management is now available.

Personalized Views for Better Focus

Organizations often have multiple units, such as maintenance plants and planning plants, each requiring a different perspective on alerts. With the new variant management, you can now filter alerts based on:

  • Maintenance Plant: Focus on where equipment requires attention.
  • Work center
  • Planning Plant: See alerts according to planned maintenance tasks.
  • Planner Group: Filter by human resource assignment for specific teams.

These options allow you to view only the alerts relevant to your role or unit, reducing noise and improving efficiency.

New Variant Management Features

  • Standard Variant: A default, pre-configured view is available to all users.

  • Custom Variants: Apply your filters and save a variant with a new name—it automatically becomes your default.

  • Public Saving: Share your custom variant with the team so everyone benefits from the same view.

  • Tile Saving: Save a variant as a personal tile on your home page for quick access.

These features allow both administrators and individual users to create, share, and streamline their views, making monitoring and decision-making faster and more intuitive.

Future Enhancements

Looking ahead, we’ll also introduce attribute-based access control. This will allow organizations to restrict visibility of certain alerts based on planning units, ensuring users only see what’s relevant to their responsibilities.

Curate Visual Inspection Results to Optimize AI Models

Data inconsistencies and poor-quality inspection data reduce AI model accuracy. Additionally, managing and deploying multiple AI models across diverse scenarios requires high manual effort.

Within the recently introduced Manage Visual Inspection Results app, you can now curate data by adding or editing visual inspection results to resolve data quality issues. You also get access to detailed inspection reports, including a change log, enabling auditable workflows for AI model training.

This business value of this is:

  • Improved AI accuracy: High-quality inspection data enables reliable predictions.

  • Faster feedback cycles: Real-time result validation accelerates model refinement.

  • Confidence in AI decisions: Curated data supports trust and compliance in AI outputs.

Stay Informed and Get Involved

  • For an exhaustive list of all new features, visit the SAP Help Portal - What's New in SAP Asset Performance Management.. 
  • Let us know what you think about these new features - leave us a comment below or ask a question!
  • Send us your improvement requests. Submit or vote for the improvement you would like to see in the SAP Continuous Influence session.

See you soon for the 2510 update!

Considering my background, could anyone suggest effective ways to get started, including which modules or resources I should prioritize? Thanks!

entry.title: Authorization control to display data for Manage Supplier Line Items using BP authorization group
entry.content:
Requirement: You need to maintain authorization for user A so that he can not see data for business partner X in the Manage Supplier Line Items application

Methodology:  Maintain authorization group for business partner X and restriction type for the corresponding business role

Overall concept: If you maintain the restriction type of a business role which is equal to a specific value, any user that is assigned that role will be able to see data of business partners that have the authorization group of that specific value and the business partners that do not belong to any authorization group.

Configuration details:

Disclaimer: "Image/data in this post is from SAP internal systems, sample data, or demo systems. Any resemblance to real data is purely coincidental." 

1. Copy the SAP standard business role "BR_AP_ACCOUNTANT" to a customized "Z_BR_AP_ACCOUNT_JANE"

2. Maintain the customized business role by restriction type "Authorization Group for Supplier Related to Journal Entries", "Authorization Group for Suppliers" with restrict value equal to "0001"

- Set other restriction types to "unrestricted" if there are no different authorization requirements other than authorization group

- Refer to KBA 2598733 - Maintain Restrictions in Business Role for more information

3. Assigned the customized business role "Z_BR_AP_ACCOUNT_JANE" to user A

4. Maintain authorization group for business partner X to be equal to "0002", for both "Business partner (Gen.)" and "Supplier (Fin. Accounting)" roles

- Refer to the "Display restriction types" application for details and examples for each restriction type

Result:

- User A cannot display data for business partner X in Manage Supplier Line Items application

- User A can display data for all business partners that have authorization groups equal to "0001" and business partners of which authorization groups have not been maintained (empty) in Manage Supplier Line Items application

See also:

- KBA 2598733 - Maintain Restrictions in Business Role

- Authorization Concept for Business Users | SAP Help Portal

entry.title: Re: Ledger EX defined in CoCd SE02 is not active in chart...
entry.content:
I am able to see in my system. The reason could be new G/L Accounting not activated in your system. The option to define non‑leading ledgers only exists if New General Ledger Accounting (a.k.a. “New G/L”) is active. In classic G/L, you won’t see this node at all. Check in SPRO → Financial Accounting (New) → Financial Accounting Global Settings (New) → Activate New General Ledger Accounting.

In S/4HANA, the ledger configuration is done via transaction FINSC_LEDGER (or via Fiori apps), not always through the old SPRO path. The customizing path may look slightly different depending on release.

entry.title: SAP B1 Service Layer – Order creation fails with “Bad Post Content” (valid JSON payload)
entry.content:
Hello experts,

I’m trying to create a sales order via SAP Business One Service Layer, but I always get the error “Bad Post Content” when posting the JSON payload.

Here’s the exact JSON I’m sending:

{
  "CardCode": "680076",
  "NumAtCard": "907873",
  "DocDate": "2025-09-29",
  "DocDueDate": "2025-09-30",
  "DocCurrency": "EUR",
  "DocumentLines": [
    {
      "FreeText": "4430023",
      "ItemCode": "L1-0-0-XXX",
      "UnitPrice": 8.8000000000000007,
      "Quantity": 1,
      "WarehouseCode": "01"
    },
    {
      "FreeText": "4430039",
      "ItemCode": "CK-32-50001-701-M",
      "UnitPrice": 5.9299999999999997,
      "Quantity": 2,
      "WarehouseCode": "01"
    }
  ],
  "Comments": "Generert fra LOGONv3 (TransferID: 1759208)",
  "U_Lokasjon": "TOTAL station Andreas Froehlich"
}

What I’ve verified so far:

  • CardCode is valid and active.
  • Both ItemCode values exist.
  • WarehouseCode = "01" exists.
  • DocCurrency = "EUR" is supported in this database.
  • UDF U_Lokasjon exists as a string field.

Any hints or ideas are much appreciated!
Thanks in advance.

entry.title: Re: Warranty for Material
entry.content:
In Public Cloud, the material master itself does not have a direct warranty tab. Instead, warranty information is usually maintained at the equipment/serialized object level or via service contracts. When a material is serialized and installed as equipment, you can assign warranty details (start date, duration, end date). This ensures that when service orders or claims are created, the system automatically checks warranty eligibility.

SAP delivers a standard scope item called Warranty Claim Management – Customer Claim Processing - Scope Item 63Y. Using the Manage Customer Claims app, you can create and process warranty claims linked to materials, spare parts, and labor. The system validates warranty eligibility based on the equipment’s warranty data.

Follow the below steps to capture Warranty details

  • Step 1: Create/extend the material with serialization enabled (if applicable).
  • Step 2: When the material is delivered to a customer, create an equipment record (automatically generated if serialization is active).
  • Step 3: In the equipment master, maintain Warranty Start Date, Warranty Duration, and Warranty End Date.
  • Step 4: During service processing (service order, repair, or claim), the system checks these warranty details.
  • Step 5: If a warranty claim is raised, use the Manage Customer Claims app to process it (pricing, reimbursement, validation).

entry.title: Introducing Carbon Accounting for Sustainability with SAP
entry.content:
A new SAP Press publication is now available: “Introducing Carbon Accounting for Sustainability with SAP”!

Written by Julia Ackermann, Bastian Distler, Christoph Ernst, Jens Freiberg, Dominik Schwarz, Christopher Sessar, Mike Szabo, Nico Wottke, and Julia Zicke.

As sustainability is no longer just a compliance requirement but a core part of how modern organizations operate, carbon accounting becomes more and more important: the systematic measurement, management, and integration of greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions into finance and operational decision-making. Capturing environmental impact data and making it meaningful across complex ERP systems is challenging—but essential.

 

What the book offers:

Our book provides a clear, practical guide to how SAP enables carbon accounting to be fully integrated into business and finance processes, helping organizations turn carbon data into actionable insights.

Dive into SAP’s integrated sustainability portfolio and see how it transforms carbon data into enterprise-wide insight:

  • Connect across solutions: Explore how SAP Green Ledger, SAP Sustainability Footprint Management, and SAP Sustainability Data Exchange work together to provide a comprehensive view of carbon emissions and environmental impact across the organization.
  • From data to insight: Learn how carbon data from across your ERP landscape is captured, harmonized, and made usable for reporting, analysis, and strategic decision-making.
  • Integrate carbon into finance: Understand how SAP Green Ledger incorporates carbon metrics into journal entries, consolidation, and sustainability disclosures — connecting environmental performance directly to financial reporting.

Why it matters:
This book goes beyond theory, showing how carbon accounting is becoming a central part of enterprise strategy, not just a reporting requirement. It demonstrates how existing ERP and finance structures can be extended to make carbon footprints measurable, auditable, and actionable.

Whether for analyzing data, preparing disclosures, or optimizing finance processes, this book provides a roadmap for understanding and leveraging SAP’s carbon accounting and sustainability tools. It’s the resource to make carbon accounting tangible, integrated, and meaningful — turning environmental data into decisions that truly matter.

The book is available in the Ebook formats EPUB / PDF / online on https://www.sap-press.com/introducing-carbon-accounting-for-sustainability-with-sap_6054/.

entry.title: Is a function module call or method call categorized as clean core level A, B, C or D?
entry.content:
Hi new Developers forum

But in the 3578329 oss notes list of technologies I miss SAP standard classes and function modules. 

Since the beginning of time SAP standard function modules were classified as Not Released, Internally Release and Released for Customers. What is the clean core level of a function module that is released for customers?

And what about classes and methods?

I have not yet had a change to use the ATC, will this tool make me wiser about the clean core level of a Z-program that use SAP standard functions and classes?

Regards Thomas

entry.title: Re: Events in Table Maintanance Generator, Sort Ascending...
entry.content:
This is the first post in the search results that allowed me to post a reply, so I'll add my solution here;

If you modify the table maintenance function group directly then you'll lose the changes if anyone regenerates the table maintenance dialog.  A better solution is to create an Implicit Enhancement at the end of Form FILL_EXTRACT (LSVIMF37).  This is included in every table maintenance dialog, but the enhancement will only be active for the function group that is chosen as the main program.  You can create multiple enhancements to cater for different table maintenance dialogs.

Here is the code:

  ENDIF.
"""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""$"$\SE:(1) Form FILL_EXTRACT, End                                                                                                                            
*$*$-Start: (1)-------------------------------------------------$*$*
ENHANCEMENT 1  Zxxxxxxxx_MAINTENANCE.    "active version
"$"$\SE:(3) Form FILL_EXTRACT, End, Enhancement Zxxxxxxxx_MAINTENANCE, Start                                                                                
DATA: sorted_extract TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF Zxxxxxxxx.

IF vim_view_name = 'Zxxxxxxxx'.
  sorted_extract = extract[].
  SORT sorted_extract BY yyyyyyyy.
  extract[] = sorted_extract.
ENDIF.
"$"$\SE:(4) Form FILL_EXTRACT, End, Enhancement ZSUP_MATRIX_MAINTENANCE, End                                                                                  
ENDENHANCEMENT.
*$*$-End:   (1)--------------------------------------------$*$*
ENDFORM.                    "fill_extract

where xxxxxxxx is the view name, and yyyyyyyy is the field name to sort by.  If you only have one view in the table maintenance function group then you can omit the IF on line 8.

Hope this helps!

entry.title: Re: Outbound cancellation gererates new Req
entry.content:
In Intercompany (STO) scenarios, the supplying plant’s outbound delivery is directly tied to the buying plant’s purchase order. When you cancel an outbound delivery (VL02N) or remove a line, SAP interprets this as a change in supply confirmation. The system then deletes the original demand element (so it disappears from MD04 and VL10) and creates a new purchase requisition in the buying plant to re‑cover the requirement. That’s why you see the PO still open, but the demand “moved” into a new requisition.

This usually starts happening if supply assignment logic changed (e.g., a recent OSS Note, support pack, or S/4HANA upgrade adjusted how intercompany STOs are handled). Customizing in MM/SD integration was changed — especially around schedule line categories or requirements class. Availability check / MRP settings were altered (e.g., requirement reduction, rescheduling).

Check in the below areas

  • In vov6, check if the schedule line category used in your STO is set to “Generate Purchase Requisition” and how it behaves on deletion.
  • In OVZG / OVZH, See if requirement reduction is active. If SAP thinks the requirement is “fulfilled” when you cancel, it will remove the demand and create a new one.

entry.title: Re: WS00800238 - Is it possible to attach PO form in emai...
entry.content:
The standard behavior is Flexible Workflow (WS00800238) supports email notifications via Output Management and Email Templates. The workflow itself does not generate or attach the PO form (Smartform/Adobe form) by default. The PO form is normally generated through Output Management (BRF+ / NAST) when the PO is approved and released.

You can explore the below options

  • Configure Output Type for Purchase Orders (e.g., PURCHASE_ORDER). Set channel = Email and assign the Adobe Form. Once the PO is approved (via WS00800238), the output is triggered and the PO PDF is sent as an attachment to the vendor. This is the SAP‑recommended approach, because it separates workflow approval from document distribution.
  • If you want the PO form attached to the workflow email itself (not just vendor output), you need an enhancement. Implement a BAdI such as MMPUR_WORKFLOW_AGENTS_V2 or use SWO1 Business Object BUS2012 to fetch the PO form. Generate the PDF using FP_JOB_OPEN / FP_FUNCTION_MODULE_NAME (for Adobe forms) or SSF_FUNCTION_MODULE_NAME (for Smartforms). Attach the PDF to the workflow email step. This requires ABAP development.

entry.title: Re: getting error Reservation 0000000000 does not exist i...
entry.content:
The WMMBXY IDoc is designed to post goods movements (GI/GR) via function module MB_CREATE_GOODS_MOVEMENT. For planned goods issues (components in the BOM), the system references a reservation number created by the order. For unplanned goods issues, the reservation number is not required; but if the IDoc segment is filled incorrectly, SAP still tries to validate a reservation. When the field is passed as 0000000000, the system interprets it as “reservation expected” but cannot find one, hence the error.

Why it worked before and not now could be because of a change in MES mapping or an SAP support package/Note that tightened validation. Earlier, SAP may have ignored a blank/zero reservation field. After updates, the system now enforces stricter checks. This aligns with SAP Note 521427 – FAQ: IDocs for goods movements, which explains that incorrect population of reservation fields in WMMBXY can cause errors

entry.title: Re: In-House Kanban EWM without using planned or producti...
entry.content:
Some of the standard options are

With Event‑Driven Kanban (EDK), trigger when the Kanban is set to Empty, the system generates a replenishment element. Instead of creating a production order, you can configure it to create a stock transfer (from warehouse to supply area). This way, no planned/production order is needed — just a transfer posting.

If the above not meeting your requirement, try with In‑House Kanban with Stock Transfer. Replenishment strategy = Stock Transfer (not Production). When Kanban is empty, the system creates a transfer requirement / warehouse task for each component. Confirmation of the WT moves stock from warehouse to the production supply area (cell). When confirmed, Kanban is set to Full.

Configuration steps are

  • Go to PK05, and link plant, storage location, and supply area (production cell).
  • Go to PKMC, and assign material, supply area, and replenishment strategy. Choose Replenishment Strategy = Stock Transfer (not Production). Source storage location = warehouse, destination = production supply area.
  • In PK12N / PK13N, Define status sequence (Empty → In Process → Full). When set to Empty, system triggers WT creation.
  • If using EWM: Map supply area to PSA (Production Supply Area). Configure PSA determination so that when Kanban is empty, EWM creates WTs for each component.

entry.title: Re: Yet another "Unspecified provider error occurred. See...
entry.content:
@raada

The action decreaseBirthdate must return a result as it is defined as "result [1] $self". Please find an example below:

  METHOD set_status_accepted.

    " Modify in local mode: BO-related updates that are not relevant for authorization checks
    MODIFY ENTITIES OF /DMO/I_Travel_M IN LOCAL MODE
           ENTITY travel
              UPDATE FIELDS ( overall_status )
                 WITH VALUE #( FOR key IN keys ( %tky      = key-%tky
                                                 overall_status = 'A' ) ). " Accepted

    " Read changed data for action result
    READ ENTITIES OF /DMO/I_Travel_M IN LOCAL MODE
      ENTITY travel
         ALL FIELDS WITH
         CORRESPONDING #( keys )
       RESULT DATA(travels).

    result = VALUE #( FOR travel IN travels ( %tky      = travel-%tky
                                              %param    = travel ) ).

  ENDMETHOD.

entry.title: Re: Business area not getting updated in F110 posted Docu...
entry.content:
Please note why the Business Area is missing in your case is because, in F110, the payment document is generated automatically from open vendor items. The system does not prompt for business area entry during payment run. Business area must be derived automatically (from customizing, substitution, or master data). Making business area “optional” in the GL account only affects manual postings (FB50, FB60, etc.). It does not influence F110, because F110 never asks the user for field entry. Besides, in ECC, business area is usually derived from:

  • Cost center / internal order / profit center assigned in the line item.
  • Rules in customizing (transaction OKB9 or substitution in FI).
  • Customer/vendor master data (if business area is assigned there).

If none of these are maintained, the payment document will have no business area.


To fix this, perform the following:

  • In transaction OKB9, assign business area to cost center, profit center, or company code. Or use FI substitution (OBBH) to populate business area during document posting.
  • Ensure vendor master has correct assignment (if you want business area derived from vendor).
  • Create a substitution rule in OBBH for application area FI → at document header or line item level. Condition: GL account = 2111215631. Substitution: Fill business area with required value. This ensures every payment document line for that GL gets a business area.
  • After substitution/derivation is set, rerun F110. The payment document should now carry the business area.

entry.title: Q3 2025 Quarterly Release Highlights: SAP BTP Security and Identity & Access Management
entry.content:
Our development teams have been busy again this quarter, delivering a range of new features and enhancements across SAP BTP Security and Identity & Access Management.

Want the full overview? You can always find a list of all new feature announcements for SAP Cloud Identity Services in the SAP Cloud Identity Services Release Notes on the SAP Help Portal.

SAP Cloud Identity Services: CAPTCHA protection

Tenant administrators can enable CAPTCHA protection for the phone verification pages of the application. See the setup guidelines here:

  • Enable Google reCAPTCHA for Application Forms 
  • Enable MTCaptcha for Application Forms

SAP Cloud Identity Services: Provided APIs

Cloud Identity Services now expose the Identity Directory API, Corporate Identity Providers API, and SAP Cloud Identity Services Application Directory as provided APIs for the Administration Console application. These can be used for principal propagation.
Learn more in the documentation: Consume APIs from the Administration Console.

Identity Directory Service and Identity Provisioning Service: Support for extension schemas towards additional SAP business applications

Default transformations of the following connectors now support attributes from the SAP extension schema for groups, including application ID, type, and supported operations:

  • SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central Payroll
  • Cloud Foundry UAA Server
  • Procurement Data Warehouse

You can find details in the SAP Cloud Identity Services Release Notes.

Identity Provisioning Service: Enhanced real-time provisioning logs

Real-time sync execution results for source systems are now displayed in a dedicated table on the real-time provisioning logs screen.

Additional information is provided in the Reason column when an entity is skipped or not provisioned.
Check the guide on how to Monitor Real-Time Logs .

Custom Domain Service: New console client command and new optional parameter for generate-csr

Two new features are available for working with custom domains:

  • New console command: Use the add-domain-certificate command to add an already uploaded certificate of a different type to the SSL host. For example, if an RSA certificate is already bound to the SSL host, you can now also add an ECC certificate—and vice versa. For details, read  add-domain-certificate.
  • New parameter: The --elliptic-curve parameter can now be used with the generate-csr command, allowing you to specify an elliptic curve for ECC algorithms. Get the details at generate-csr.

Authorization and Trust Management Service: Automatic Signing Key Rotation for Access Tokens

We’re now offering automatic rotation of the signing key for access tokens. It is disabled by default; when enabled, SAP BTP rotates the signing key periodically. See Rotate Signing Keys of Access Tokens for details. As of January 2026, we plan to enable this feature by default for new subaccounts

Stay connected

Want to stay up to date on our services? Join our SAP BTP Security and SAP Cloud Identity Services communities!

entry.title: Re: Add additional column to the Va02,Va03 incompletion log.
entry.content:
The incompletion procedures define which fields are checked, but not the layout of the incompletion log screen itself. The screen layout (columns displayed) is hard‑coded in SAP standard and cannot be changed via customizing.

Two options are there to meet this requirement. They are

You would need to enhance the incompletion log screen program (SAPMV45A, screen 4209) or use an implicit enhancement in the relevant function module (SD_INCOMP_LOG_DISPLAY). This is a technical development (ABAP + screen enhancement), not a customizing step.

Instead of adding a column, you can add your extra information to the “Description” field dynamically (via user exit USEREXIT_INCOMPLETE_DOCUMENT in include MV45AFZZ). This way, the additional info is visible without changing the screen layout. This is the most common workaround because it avoids modifying the SAP standard screen.

entry.title: Re: Data Transfer Tool
entry.content:
Hi @SwapnamolShaji thank you for the great SAP Blog post!
I’d love to add two small points, if I may:

  1. Choosing the right migration tool – It’s crucial to understand the existing system landscape. For example, if you are moving from an SAP ECC and C4C setup to an S/4 and SAP Sales/Service Cloud V2 landscape, you need to pay close attention to the external IDs (UUID) of business partners, since they are linked to all transactional data. In this context, it might be worth considering a more “classic” migration approach using Data Workbench with import/export and possibly APIs.

  2. What does a “phased approach in the Data Transfer Tool” mean? – In this scenario, all data is first loaded into SAP Sales and Service Cloud V2. Once that has been completed, you’ll need to adapt the authorization concept for the users in the source system, so that only the users intended to work with the V2 system in the first phase have the right access. It’s also important to keep in mind that the V2 system does not write back into V1.

Best regards,
Markus

entry.title: Re: I have done the PGI and invoice also, but inventory i...
entry.content:
When you post PGI (Post Goods Issue) in SAP, the system should immediately reduce stock in the delivering plant/storage location. If inventory is not reduced even after PGI, it usually points to one of these issues:

  • Delivery would not have PGId (note, you can invoice even before PGI in standard). Check via VA02 document flow whether after delivery, you are able to see material document reference. Share a screen shot of the document flow if you are not sure on this.
  • Wrong Movement type. In standard, 601 is the standard movement type for goods issue. If the system considers other movement type, system may not reduce inventory. Check what schedule line category is flowing in sales order. Then, go to VOV6, select that schedule line category and check which movement type is assigned.
  • If it’s consignment, subcontracting, or stock transport, the goods may have moved into a special stock category (e.g., customer consignment stock) instead of reducing unrestricted stock. Use MBEWH/MMBE to check stock by special stock indicator.

entry.title: System allows submission even when a mandatory field is left empty due to document deletion
entry.content:
Hello community folks,
I have a query related to Successfactors SAP SuccessFactors Onboarding #onboarding additional data collection step

In the Additional Data Collection (ADC) step of the candidate, the system allows submission even when a mandatory field is left empty due to document deletion. We have created a custom UI for uploading the highest education and work experience document. Fields have been kept as mandatory but still the candidate can proceed without any error post deleting the document.

Steps to Reproduce:

  1. Candidate navigates to the ADC step and clicks on "Please Upload your Education and Experience Details."
  2. Candidate uploads a document in the "Please Upload Highest Education Document" field (which is marked as mandatory).
  3. Candidate clicks Submit — the status updates to Completed.
  4. Candidate revisits the "Please Upload your Education and Experience Details" section.
  5. Candidate deletes the previously uploaded document from the "Please Upload Highest Education Document" field.
  6. Candidate clicks Close, then clicks on Submit in the ADC step.

The system should validate the mandatory field and prevent submission, displaying an error message indicating that the "Highest Education Document" is required. Instead, the system allows submission without any error message, and the workflow proceeds to the next step despite the mandatory field being empty.

Thanking you for reply and help in advance.

entry.title: Re: MDG replication of field not successful
entry.content: Yes, this field should be never used in s4hana environment. Please check with business side the purpose they are using this field for. And check if you can find some other field to replace it.

entry.title: Re: Manual Accrual getting reversed at the time of Delta...
entry.content:
When you run a Delta Accrual, the system recalculates the total accrual requirement based on business volume and conditions. It then reverses all previously posted accruals (manual or automatic) using condition type RED2, and reposts the new delta amount. That’s why your manual delta accrual of 300 USD is being reversed — the system doesn’t distinguish between “migration/manual” and “system” accruals once they sit in the same accrual group.

Why it is happening is because, in customizing, the Condition Type Group for Accruals defines which condition types are reversed during delta accrual runs. If your manual delta accrual condition (e.g. RENT/REA1) is included in that group, the system will always reverse it with RED2 in the next delta run. SAP’s design assumption is that only final settlement should leave accruals standing; delta runs are meant to keep the accrual balance aligned with current business volume.

Few choices which you can explore

Don’t include the manual accrual condition in the accrual group. If you leave your manual condition type (e.g. RENT) out of the accrual group, the delta run won’t reverse it. Downside: it also won’t be considered in automatic settlement, so you’d need to handle reversal manually at final settlement.

Use a separate adjustment condition type. Instead of posting migration adjustments as “manual delta accruals,” create a dedicated rebate adjustment condition (e.g. REJ1). This condition is not part of the accrual group, so it won’t be touched by delta runs. At final settlement, it will still be cleared.

Another SAP‑recommended approach is to create a business volume document representing the adjustment. Then the delta accrual run will naturally include it in its calculation, and you won’t need a manual delta accrual at all

Raquel

entry.title: Re: How to do background scheduling with clean core, including Fiori apps, replacing se38 reports
entry.content:
Hi @Shashank_Gupta_BTP 

Sorry for my late reply. I needed to do some checking on this one.

The examples you showed were among others application job catalog entry SAP_FIN_GL_AUTO_CLR, which is in fact se38 program based, not class-based, as we tried to do here, for again, staying in ABAP Cloud.

The result is only set if the application job created a spool. This would not be possible for BTP ABAP environment or public cloud. For on-premise or private cloud, I honestly don't know what would happen if you add some WRITE command into your application job class. It would need to be Standard ABAP and not ABAP Cloud, thus making it not clean core level A anymore. So you could just try that, or other ways like RSPO_SR_OPEN/WRITE/CLOSE (not sure those would work either, but they are stable classic API from the cloudification repository).

Another option you could do is make use of emails and for example email an attachment, at the end of your job execution.

But as far as the Result column goes in the standard app, that is for spool only, as far as I know. 

Regards

Thank you in advance and best regards,

Mihai

entry.title: Authentification required to access the ATO service
entry.content:
Dear Community,

I am trying to deploy a freestyle SAPUI5 application to our S/4HANA Public Cloud system using Business Application Studio. When I run npm run deploy-config, it prompts me to authenticate in order to access the ATO service (screenshot attached). However, when I enter my S/4HANA Public Cloud development tenant credentials, the authentication fails with the error “Incorrect credentials”—despite entering the correct details.

I am currently using a destination with authentication type set to BasicAuthentication.

I found a similar issue  but seems relevant for On-Premise systems, but I’m not sure which role in S/4HANA Public Cloud provides the ATO-related authorization objects. Additionally, the error message “Incorrect credentials” is misleading, since the credentials are valid for logging into the development tenant.

Has anyone else faced this issue? If so, how did you resolve it?

Thank you!

Best regards,
Karthik

entry.title: Subscription to SAP Build process automation is consistantly failing in BTP trial account

Hi, 

The subscription is taking longer times and finally having failed status in the BTP trial account.

entry.title: Re: PO header and item text do not appear in printed form in selected languages
entry.content: Texts will print in the correspondence language of the supplier which is what gets recorded to the PO header during creation.

entry.title: Re: @sap/fiori:app generator failed error
entry.content: Did the save of the system details work, did you get any errors on the save, as the second screen shows that no system is selected and thus the services drop down is not able to select any services? I am not sure how you got to the second screen as the flow expects that a system is selected first before the services lookup is started. I recommend (if possible) that you create a support ticket so we can better support you where you can share more private details: https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_FIORI_tools/1bb01966b27a429ebf62fa2e45354fea/5b5d9dc53aac46b69caebb95c1a242eb.html?locale=en-US

entry.title: Re: Dunning per Mail/Printing only if there is no Mail-Ad...
entry.content:
Hello @FabianSCC

The colums you are using seem to be part of the issue. Can you modify your table this way?

Step 1 (Email): Condition = Email address is not initial (this is the condition and not the default email column). Channel = Email. Exclusive = X.

Step 2 (PRINT): No condition. Channel = PRINT. Exclusive remains blank

Step

Output Type

Condition

Channel

Exclusive Indicator

Purpose

1

DUNN_NOTICE

Default E-Mail Address ≠ initial

EMAIL

x

If a BP has email, send only by email.

2

DUNN_NOTICE

(no condition)

PRINT

-

If no email exists, fallback to print.

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: SD2 not getting created for RE2 with multiple line it...
entry.content: Thank you Lakshmipathi, appreciate your response

entry.title: Re: Custom Money field is not working as expected
entry.content: Krishna, there are so many things that could be the issue here, more context is needed. I would confirm the currency conversion rate because if that is set to 1, the rates would be the same. Second, I would expect you have a custom formula in custom field, you need to ensure that all the fields there are properly calculating and that there is not a problem with a field within the formula. I might suggest you start by redefining the formula by deconstructing it into its pieces and recalculating the bonus to pinpoint where it may be going wrong. Also, it would be helpful to show screenshots of the custom field from the column designer and then show what the form looks like when you see it in functional vs. local. Maybe I can help troubleshoot if you provide more information.

entry.title: SAP Connect – Finance Connect, Las Vegas, Nevada
entry.content:
SAP Connect – Finance Connect, Las Vegas, Nevada

In-person event | October 6–8, 2025

Join us at the first SAP Connect, Finance Connect in Las Vegas, Nevada from October 6-8 2025!

Find out everything you need to know about the event here.

Explore the session catalog for a complete overview of all presentations, customer success stories, learnings, deep dives, latest innovations and more…

 

Agenda Highlights:

Keynote:

Finance as the conductor of the connected enterprise | FINKEY0005

Organizational success requires integration, not isolation. Collaborative finance teams benefit from simplified processes, increased productivity and enterprise-wide risk visibility. SAP Business Suite, with extensive applications, AI, and data, makes the connection. See how SAP solutions help finance connect across the enterprise to drive impact.

Presenters:

Alex Zimmermann, Director, Working Capital, Pfizer

David Imbert, Head of Finance Product Marketing, SAP

Tamzin Booth, Editorial Director, THE ECONOMIST GROUP LIMITED

Lawrence Martin, Chief Product Officer and Head of Cloud Engineering, SAP

Mary Kumar, Senior Vice President, Align Technology

Stephanie Miller, Global Vice President, SAP AMERICA, INC.

Lyle Honig Mojica, CFO, AIDS Healthcare Foundation

Dominik Asam, SAP CFO, SAP

Roadmap:

Transforming finance-led ERP and beyond: Laser-focused innovations unveiled | FIN2161

Discover the road map for finance-led ERP software from SAP and plans to deliver increasingly powerful solutions for the CFO organization through integrated capabilities in finance, sales, and procurement in the cloud. See how the combined strengths of applications, data, and AI from SAP can enable your business to transform in an uncertain world.

Presenters:

Sabrina Kunze, SVP, Head of Product Cloud ERP Finance - Service Centric, SAP SE

Johannes Beigel, Head of Public Cloud ERP Product Management, Finance, SAP SE

We look forward to seeing you in Las Vegas!

Should you not be able to join us in Las Vegas

Register now for SAP Connect Virtual

Join our virtual event on October 9, 2025. Registration includes access to on-demand content that you can explore anytime.

Register now
